EmailTemplate.name: ENG-OpenStack-Nurture.ENG-OpenStack-Early-01.01-What-Is-OpenStack-Blog
EmailTemplate.subject: What Is OpenStack?
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[http://turbonomic.com/blog/on-technology/openstack-pt-1/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=eng-openstack&utm_content=early01]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=There}}, There is a lot of buzz in the industry around OpenStack. The name is used alongside major players on both the public cloud, as well as in private cloud product environments. All of this buzz is for good reason; organizations are moving towards OpenStack cloud for the promise of no vendor lock-in, IT agility, and competitive differentiation. Before we dig into these benefits though, lets take a step back and really define what OpenStack is. Click below to read the two-part blog post and learn:
- What OpenStack is - The history behind OpenStack - The separate programs that make OpenStack what it is today
What is OpenStack? Part I <[[http://turbonomic.com/blog/on-technology/openstack-pt-1/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=eng-openstack&utm_content=early01]]> What is OpenStack? Part II <[[http://turbonomic.com/blog/on-technology/openstack-pt-2/?utm_source=turbonomic&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=eng-openstack&utm_content=early01]]> -The Turbonomic Team
